title: The Fondation Cartier unveils its new landmark in central Paris
subhead: The Fondation Cartier for Contemporary Art has moved to Place du Palais-Royal in Paris. Like its previous location on Boulevard Raspail, the new building was designed by architect Jean Nouvel, conceived as an innovative, flexible space that can be configured in countless ways.

subhead: Reactions to the Louvre heist ignore the complex equation museums face: offering generous public access while securing cumbersome objects better suited for a bank vault, explains Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Sarkozy imprisonment: Protection of ex-president by armed officers angers prison guards
subhead: On Wednesday, interior minister Laurent Nuñez defended the measure, citing Nicolas Sarkozy's 'status' and 'threats against him.' Prison guard unions decried it as 'security madness' and 'unprecedented humiliation.'
byline: Antoine Albertini,  Grégoire Biseau and  Soren Seelow

title: A former mining city in northern China has become a budget tourist destination
subhead: Driven by the reconstruction of its downtown area and the redevelopment of disused mining sites, China's northern city of Datong, located 350 kilometers west of Beijing, has been experiencing a boost in tourism.
